Blog posts.title: JPEG XL and Core Web Vitals: what you need to know now that Chrome ships it
Blog posts.Author: Arjen Karel
Blog posts.Summary: How JPEG XL compares to AVIF, WebP and JPEG, what it means for your Core Web Vitals, and how to start serving it today.

Blog posts.title: JPEG XL Returns to Chrome: From Obsolete to the Future
Blog posts.Author: Helmut Januschka
Blog posts.Summary: How JPEG XL went from "obsolete" to the future of web images in Chromium: the story of its return, the jxl-rs Rust decoder integration, and the honor of being part of its comeback. Status: landed in Chromium Canary 145.0.7632.0+.

Blog posts.title: Why JPEG XL Ignoring Bit Depth Is Genius (And Why AVIF Can’t Pull It Off)
Blog posts.Author: Kelly Thompson
Blog posts.Summary: JPEG XL’s  approach of ignoring bit depth in favor of floating-point perceptual compression with intensity targets frees it from the rigid integer-based constraints that plague AVIF’s video codec heritage.

Blog posts.title: AIC-3 and HDR image quality assessment
Blog posts.Author: Jon Sneyers
Blog posts.Summary: Researchers applied JPEG AIC-3 methodology to precisely assess HDR image compression quality using JND measurements.

Blog posts.title: JPEG XL: The Storage Solution Apple (and Your Drive) Has Been Waiting For
Blog posts.Author: Kelly Thompson
Blog posts.Summary: JPEG XL Is Here – Now Apple Just Needs to Fully Embrace It Across its Development Environment

Blog posts.title: Just How Much Space Would JPEG XL Save in Your Photos Library?
Blog posts.Author: Kelly Thompson
Blog posts.Summary: An ATP podcast discussion raises the question: How much space would Apple save by switching to JPEG XL in the Photos app?

Blog posts.title: iPhone 16 Adds JPEG XL
Blog posts.Author: Michael Tsai
Blog posts.Summary: Discussion around what it means to have JPEG XL supported in iPhone 16 Pro DNG containers.

Blog posts.title: JPEG XL: What It Is And Why You Should Care
Blog posts.Author: Jaron Schneider
Blog posts.Summary: PetaPixel interview with Jon Sneyers (JPEG XL standard editor) on what JPEG XL is, why it matters for photographers, and why you should use it.

Blog posts.title: JPEG XL's Modular Mode Explained
Blog posts.Author: Jon Sneyers
Blog posts.Summary: An exploration of JPEG XL’s lossless modular mode, which is capable of creating impressively small image files.

Blog posts.title: Linear Color Analysis of Modern Image Formats
Blog posts.Author: Kampidh
Blog posts.Summary: A comparison of the performance of JPEG XL, AVIF, and WebP in handling wide-gamut linear color profiles.

Blog posts.title: Level up your images: JPEG XL now supported by Image Optimizer
Blog posts.Author: Ping Hu
Blog posts.Summary: Fastly adds support for JPEG XL in their Image Optimizer Professional platform.

Blog posts.title: JPEG XL and the Pareto Front
Blog posts.Author: Jon Sneyers
Blog posts.Summary: An exploration of JPEG XL’s performance on the image compression Pareto front versus other encoders.

Blog posts.title: Samsung Now Supports DNG 1.7, Including JPEG XL
Blog posts.Author: Cloudinary Team
Blog posts.Summary: Samsung’s Galaxy S24 ships with JPEG XL support, using it as an “Expert RAW” format

Blog posts.title: XYB JPEG
Blog posts.Author: Gianni Rosato
Blog posts.Summary: While JXL leads the pack, XYB JPEG outperforms all other JPEG formats and surpasses AVIF at high-fidelity ranges

Blog posts.title: Google’s decision to deprecate JPEG-XL emphasizes the need for browser choice and free formats
Blog posts.Author: Greg Farough
Blog posts.Summary: Google's decision to deprecate JPEG XL in Chrome highlights the importance of browser diversity and the need for free and open image formats, like JPEG XL, to ensure that users are not locked into proprietary technologies.

Blog posts.title: Introducing the Galaxy S24 Camera/Gallery!
Blog posts.Author: CamcyclopediaExpert
Blog posts.Summary: Samsung’s Galaxy S24 series supports JPEG XL, a significant milestone for the adoption of this new image format

Blog posts.title: JPEG XL vs AVIF: A Comparison
Blog posts.Author: Toni Sagristà Sellés
Blog posts.Summary: An unscientific analysis of these two image formats based on file size and image quality.

Blog posts.title: The Case for JPEG XL
Blog posts.Author: Jon Sneyers
Blog posts.Summary: A detailed case for the adoption of JPEG XL as a primary image format.

Blog posts.title: Contemplating Codec Comparisons
Blog posts.Author: Jon Sneyers
Blog posts.Summary: A response to the AVIF team's comparison of AVIF, JPEG XL, WebP, and JPEG. Discusses decoding vs rendering speed, progressive decoding, encoding speed and quality settings, quality metrics (e.g. SSIMULACRA 2), BD rates in web-relevant quality ranges, and a feature comparison table. At useful presets, 9 out of 13 quality metrics favor JPEG XL.

Blog posts.title: Using Saliency in Progressive JPEG XL Images
Author: Moritz Firsching
Junfeng He
Blog posts.Summary: Discussion on the use of saliency maps in creating progressive JPEG XL images.

Blog posts.title: Time for Next-Gen Codecs to Dethrone JPEG
Blog posts.Author: Jon Sneyers
Blog posts.Summary: An argument for why next-gen codecs like JPEG XL are poised to replace JPEG.

Blog posts.title: Legacy and Transition: Creating a New Universal Image Codec
Blog posts.Author: Jon Sneyers
Blog posts.Summary: Insights into the creation and adoption of JPEG XL as a universal image codec.

Blog posts.title: Improve the Web Experience With Progressive Image Decoding
Blog posts.Author: Jon Sneyers
Blog posts.Summary: How progressive image decoding with JPEG XL can enhance web experiences.

Blog posts.title: What to Focus on in Image Compression: Fidelity Or Appeal
Blog posts.Author: Jon Sneyers
Blog posts.Summary: Discussing the balance between fidelity and appeal in Image Compression.

Blog posts.title: Cloudinary Supports JPEG XL
Blog posts.Author: Jon Sneyers
Blog posts.Summary: Announcement of Cloudinary's support for JPEG XL.

Blog posts.title: How JPEG XL Compares to Other Image Codecs
Blog posts.Author: Jon Sneyers
Blog posts.Summary: A comparative analysis of JPEG XL and other image codecs.

Blog posts.title: FUIF: Introducing FUIF
Blog posts.Author: Jon Sneyers
Blog posts.Summary: Introduction to FUIF and its benefits for responsive images.

Blog posts.title: FUIF: Why Another Image Format?
Blog posts.Author: Jon Sneyers
Blog posts.Summary: Explaining the need for a new image format like FUIF.

Blog posts.title: FUIF: Legacy Friendliness
Blog posts.Author: Jon Sneyers
Blog posts.Summary: Discussion on the legacy friendliness of the FUIF image format.

Papers.title: Fine-Grained HDR Image Quality Assessment From Noticeably Distorted to Very High Fidelity
Author: Mohsen Jenadeleh
Jon Sneyers
Davi Lazzarotto
Shima Mohammadi
Dominik Keller
Atanas Boev
Rakesh Rao Ramachandra Rao
António Pinheiro
Thomas Richter
Alexander Raake
Touradj Ebrahimi
João Ascenso
Dietmar Saupe
Papers.Summary: Introduces AIC-HDR2025, the first HDR image quality dataset, using the JPEG AIC-3 methodology to assess four codecs (including JPEG XL) from visible distortion to visually lossless.

Papers.title: The JPEG XL Image Coding System: History, Features, Coding Tools, Design Rationale, and Future
Author: Jon Sneyers
Jyrki Alakuijala
Luca Versari
Zoltán Szabadka
Sami Boukortt
Amnon Cohen-Tidhar
Moritz Firsching
Evgenii Kliuchnikov
Tal Lev-Ami
Eric Portis
Thomas Richter
Osamu Watanabe
Papers.Summary: JPEG XL is a new image coding system offering state-of-the-art compression performance, lossless JPEG recompression, and advanced features. It aims to replace JPEG, PNG, GIF, and other formats with a single universal codec. This article provides an overview of JPEG XL, including its history, design rationale, coding tools, and future potential.

Papers.Title: Compression of Spectral Images using Spectral JPEG XL
Author: Alban Fichet
Christoph Peters
Papers.Publication: The Journal of Computer Graphics Techniques
Papers.Summary: Efficiently compressing spectral images, this new method uses cosine transforms and adaptive JPEG XL encoding to achieve 10–60× smaller file sizes while preserving perceptual quality.

Papers.title: History and environmental impact of digital image formats
Papers.Author: Jon Sneyers
Papers.Summary: From analogue film to digital storage and transfer: the ecological footprint of photography, the role of lossy compression, and how newer formats like JPEG XL could reduce the environmental cost of the trillions of photos we produce each year.

Papers.title: Analysis and Enhancement of Lossless Image Compression in JPEG-XL
Papers.Author: Rustam Mamedov
Papers.Summary: Evaluates lossless compression in JPEG XL and explores codebase modifications to improve compression ratio; one prediction method improves results for specific image types.

Papers.title: JPEG XL White Paper
Papers.Author: JPEG Committee
Papers.Summary: The official white paper on JPEG XL.

Papers.title: Benchmarking JPEG XL image compression
Author: Jyrki Alakuijala

Touradj Ebrahimi
Evgenii Kliuchnikov
Jon Sneyers
Evgeniy Upenik
Lode Vandevenne
Luca Versari
Jan Wassenberg
Papers.Summary: Benchmarking study of JPEG XL lossy and lossless image compression performance.

Papers.title: JPEG XL next-generation image compression architecture and coding tools
Author: Jyrki Alakuijala
Ruud van Asseldonk
Sami Boukortt
Martin Bruse
Iulia-Maria Comșa
Moritz Firsching
Thomas Fischbacher
Evgenii Kliuchnikov
Sebastian Gomez

Alexander Rhatushnyak
Jon Sneyers
Zoltán Szabadka
Lode Vandevenne
Luca Versari
Jan Wassenberg
Papers.Summary: Technical overview of JPEG XL architecture and coding tools.

Papers.title: Assessment of quality of JPEG XL proposals based on subjective methodologies and objective metrics
Author: Pinar Akyazi
Touradj Ebrahimi
Papers.Summary: Quality assessment framework for JPEG XL CfP proposals: subjective experiments in three labs and objective metrics on SDR and HDR content.

Papers.title: ISO/IEC N83043: JPEG XL Use Cases and Requirements
Papers.Author: JPEG Committee
Papers.Summary: Formal use cases and requirements document for the JPEG XL standard.

Papers.title: ISO/IEC N79010: Final Call for Proposals for a Next-Generation Image Coding Standard (JPEG XL)
Papers.Author: JPEG Committee
Papers.Summary: Final call for proposals that led to the JPEG XL standardization process.

Presentations.title: JPEG XL Overview (Slide Deck is Kept Up-to-Date)
Presentations.Author: Jon Sneyers
Presentations.Summary: An up-to-date overview slide deck of JPEG XL.

Presentations.title: JPEG XL: What It Is And Why You Should Care
Author: Chris Niccolls
Jordan Drake
Jaron Schneider
Jon Sneyers
Presentations.Summary: Podcast episode with Jon Sneyers explaining JPEG XL — what it is, why it matters, and why photographers should care.

Presentations.title: JPEG XL: The Next Generation ‘Alien Technology From The Future’ (ImageReady)
Author: Jon Sneyers
Henri Helvetica
Presentations.Summary: Presentation on JPEG XL’s advanced technology and future potential.

Presentations.title: JPEG XL: An Update (ImageReady 1.2)
Author: Jon Sneyers
Henri Helvetica
Presentations.Summary: Update on JPEG XL’s developments and improvements.

Presentations.title: Next-Generation of Image Formats for the Web, ImageCon
Presentations.Author: ImageCon Team
Presentations.Summary: Discussion on the next-generation image formats including JPEG XL at ImageCon.

News.Title: Google's Chromium team decides it will add JPEG XL support, reverses 'obsolete' declaration
News.Author: Tim Anderson
News.Summary: The Chromium team has declared its intention to ship a JPEG XL decoder, reversing the October 2022 decision. Rick Byers cited Safari adoption, Firefox's position, PDF standardization, and developer demand. A Rust-based decoder (jxl-rs) is the likely path.

News.Title: Google Looks To Bring JPEG-XL Support Back To Chrome / Chromium
News.Author: Michael Larabel
News.Summary: After controversially removing JPEG XL support in 2022, Google is now bringing the modern image format back to Chrome following widespread adoption by Safari and Firefox, and strong developer demand.

News.Title: Google Revisits JPEG XL in Chromium After Earlier Removal
News.Author: Venkat
News.Summary: Google has restarted work on bringing JPEG XL to Chrome, after Safari, Windows 11, and the PDF standard adopted it.

News.Title: CAST Introduces JPEG XL Encoder IP Core for High-Quality, On-Camera Still-Image Compression
News.Author: CAST
News.Summary: CAST has launched the first commercial JPEG XL encoder IP core for camera SoCs, enabling hardware-based real-time compression that delivers superior image quality at smaller file sizes than legacy JPEG while supporting 4K/8K, HDR, and wide color gamut.

News.Title: Another chance for JPEG XL? PDF will support format as ‘preferred solution’
News.Author: Tim Anderson
News.Summary: The PDF Association is adopting JPEG XL as its preferred solution for HDR images despite Google Chrome declaring the format obsolete, potentially reviving mainstream adoption through PDF’s inclusion of the advanced image format that offers superior compression and billion-pixel support.

News.Title: Philips announces digital pathology scanner with native, configurable DICOM JPEG and JPEG XL output in world first
News.Author: Philips
News.Summary: Philips has launched the world’s first digital pathology scanner with native DICOM JPEG XL output, enabling smaller file sizes, scalable storage, and seamless integration for pathology workflows.

News.Title: Ubuntu 25.04 Now Ships With JPEG-XL Support Enabled By Default
News.Author: Michael Larab
News.Summary: The Ubuntu 25.04 release shipping this month will now feature JPEG-XL image format support out-of-the-box.

News.Title: March 2025 Microsoft Photos update now rolling out to Windows Insiders
News.Author: Lydia Ko, Senior Product Manager, Microsoft Photos
News.Summary: Due to popular requests, the Photos app now supports JXL files.

News.Title: Is JPEG the Future of Photography? The Results Are Incredible
News.Author: Alex Armitage
News.Summary: JPEG XL offers raw-like flexibility at just 10% of the file size, with support for 32-bit color depth, HDR, and wide color gamuts, making it an efficient alternative already integrated into Adobe’s DNG workflow.

News.Title: Why Apple Uses JPEG XL in the iPhone 16 and What it Means for Your Photos
News.Author: Jeremy Gray
News.Summary: Apple’s adoption of JPEG XL in the iPhone 16 enables more efficient compression and may pave the way for wider industry adoption of this next-generation image compression standard.

News.Title: iPhone 16 Pro lets users capture ProRAW photos in JPEG XL format
News.Author: Filipe Espósito
News.Summary: Firmware seen by 9to5Mac for iPhone 16 Pro confirms support for shooting ProRAW photos with JPEG XL compression.

News.Title: iPhone 16 Pro Supports JPEG XL Format
News.Author: Juli Clover
News.Summary: The iPhone 16 Pro models will support the JPEG XL file format, according to code found in iOS 18.

News.Title: iPhone 16 Pro to shoot 4K 120fps videos, Camera Button works with third-party apps
News.Author: Filipe Espósito
News.Summary: JPEG XL support rumored for capturing lossy and lossless photos on the iPhone 16 Pro

News.Title: Mozilla Is Interested In A Rust JPEG-XL Decoder For Firefox & Google Might Develop It
News.Author: Michael Larabel
News.Summary: Mozilla is exploring the adoption of a Rust-based JPEG-XL decoder, contingent on assurances of security, performance, and compatibility.

News.Title: Green coding – Cloudinary: Could a JPEG successor render greener?
News.Author: Adrian Bridgwater
News.Summary: Cloudinary’s JPEG XL optimizes compression and efficiency, reducing storage costs, lowers bandwidth consumption, decreasing carbon emissions at a massive scale.

News.Title: Google’s Jpegli open-source library can compress high quality images 35% more than traditional JPEG codecs
News.Author: Jean-Luc Aufranc
News.Summary: Google’s Jpegli open-source library offers a next-gen Image Compression codec that can compress images up to 35% more than traditional JPEG while maintaining the same quality.

News.Title: Linux Mint 22 Will Use The PipeWire Sound Server, Support JPEG XL Images
News.Author: Michael Larabel
News.Summary: JPEG XL support comes to Linux Mint

News.Title: Google is once again accused of snubbing the JPEG XL image format
News.Author: Alfonso Maruccia
News.Summary: Google is facing criticism for allegedly ignoring the JPEG XL image format, a more efficient and higher-quality alternative to traditional JPEG, in its Chrome browser and Android operating system.

News.Title: Still no love for JPEG XL: Browser maker love-in snubs next-gen image format
News.Author: Thomas Claburn
News.Summary: The JPEG XL image format, designed to replace traditional JPEG, has reached a major milestone with the announcement of interoperability between different implementations, paving the way for wider adoption in 2024.

News.Title: The new Pixelmator Pro update enables a full HDR image editing workflow
News.Author: Benjamin Mayo
News.Summary: Full HDR workflow comes to Pixelmator Pro with support for JPEG XL

News.Title: Google snubbed JPEG XL so of course Apple now supports it in Safari
News.Author: Thomas Claburn
News.Summary: Apple’s Safari browser now supports JPEG XL, a next-generation image format that offers better compression and quality than traditional JPEG, marking a significant milestone in the format’s adoption.
